#Text=The San Antonio Spurs ( 17 - 4 ) held off the Boston Celtics ( 11 - 9 ) 108 - 105 to keep their home court undefeated streak alive .
#Text=The Spurs came into this game 100 at home with a dominating 17 - point differential average and they were fortunate to keep that streak alive here .
#Text=This game came down to the wire , even though the Spurs led by 17 points late in the third quarter .
#Text=San Antonio outrebounded Boston 48 - 39 and outshot them 52 percent to 45 percent .
#Text=Even though it goes down as a loss in the record book , this is a game the young Celtics can build off of .
#Text=Boston came into this game as double - digit underdogs and nearly escaped with an impressive win .
#Text=They were trailing big , but fought back to make it a two - point game with 10 seconds left .
#Text=They couldn’t quite pull it off , but it was a great effort all - around .
#Text=Boston was led by Isaiah Thomas , who tallied 23 points , eight assists and four rebounds in the loss .
#Text=The team had four players score 16 or more points and that’s indicative of this teams nature , as they play team - ball in an individualized sport .
#Text=The Celtics will look to rebound when they take on the disappointing New Orleans Pelicans on Monday .
#Text=The Spurs did not have a single player who scored more than 17 points , but that 's not a huge surprise with this San Antonio team .
#Text=The bench was spectacular , as they combined for 54 points , 22 rebounds and 11 assists in the win .
#Text=The high - scorer for the Spurs on this evening was LaMarcus Aldridge , who collected 17 points and eight rebounds .
#Text=The Spurs are quietly putting together another fantastic start to the season and they are going to be tough to beat at home come playoff time .
#Text=Up next for San Antonio is the one - win Philadelphia 76ers on Monday , in what could very well be a lopsided game .
